titlStmt.titl: Replication Data for: Bumble bees (Hymenoptera: Apidae) respond to moth (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae) pheromone components, leading to bee bycatch in monitoring traps targeting moth pests

citation.biblCit: Grocock, Nicholas; Batallas, Ronald; McNamara, Emily; Sturm, Ashton; Manson, Jessamyn; Evenden, Maya, 2020, "Replication Data for: Bumble bees (Hymenoptera: Apidae) respond to moth (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae) pheromone components, leading to bee bycatch in monitoring traps targeting moth pests", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/ZGXPKE, UAL Dataverse, V1, UNF:6:N8k4jHgAFYkQIUMUyOml8A== [fileUNF]

titlStmt.titl: Replication Data for: Bumble bees (Hymenoptera: Apidae) respond to moth (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae) pheromone components, leading to bee bycatch in monitoring traps targeting moth pests

stdyInfo.abstract: Data associated with a study investigating the capture of wild bees in moth pheromone-baited traps in agricultural settings in Alberta, Canada. Files contain raw data on records for all captured bee specimens as well as electroantennogram (EAG) responses.

citation.biblCit: Grocock N, Batallas R, McNamara E, Sturm A, Manson J, Evenden M. 2020. Bumble bees (Hymenoptera: Apidae) respond to moth (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae) pheromone components, leading to bee bycatch in monitoring traps targeting moth pests. Frontiers in Ecology and Evolution.
